company: HSBC Service Delivery (Polska) Sp. z o.o.
about: We are seeking an experienced Delivery Manager to join us in our fast-paced Platform as a Service (PaaS) team within the Engineering Foundation Value Stream (VS). Engineering Foundation is an Enabler Value Stream that will enable and accelerate Wealth and Personal Banking (WPB) engineering teams to develop resilient and performant applications, delivering value to the business more easily and quickly. This will be achieved through a fully managed strategic and cost optimised Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) for developing and deploying applications to the cloud. Our goal is to help HSBC teams deliver cost-effective journeys securely. Our attention to detail needs to be excellent as should our ability to assess ‘the bigger picture’. You will be part of a cross functional team transforming our digital capabilities. Driving innovation, delivering products in ever shortening cycles and helping to drive the continuous improvement of our processes, tooling, and engineering practices. The Delivery Manager is a passionate, inspiring technologist who leads by example, champions’ innovation and quality and knows how to deliver. They will be able to deliver accurate data and will be held accountable for the successful delivery of technology projects and ensuring benefits realisation. We are looking for an accomplished Delivery Manager to contribute to our goals.
duties: Facilitate the delivery of working software from concept to live using Agile methodologies as well as help align business goals with release plans to ensure timely delivery of features.
Foster collaboration among teams and protect the team from external influences or distractions.

Work alongside Product Owners, other Scrum Masters/Delivery Managers and closely with the Delivery Lead to enable and ensure the team has all they need to deliver on time, removing impediments as you go.
Facilitate the Scrum process by arranging and leading agile ceremonies, daily scrum, sprint planning, sprint review, refinement sessions, discovery sessions, sprint demo and retrospectives.
Plan and schedule the delivery increment while maintaining the teams’ scrum board as well as challenge the team to improve on process and inspire them to find new better ways of working.
Help identify and mitigate delivery risks and dependencies.
Drive, track, and communicate the progress of sprints and releases through team velocity and burn down charts and other useful metrics.
You will be responsible for achieving targets and meeting expectations whilst supporting and encouraging others to do the same.
requirements: Strong practical experience and understanding of SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework)/Agile methodologies, Scrum and Kanban.
Proven track record of successfully delivering to key objectives and deliverables, on time, to scope and within budget.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills and proven experience managing global stakeholders and teams.
Experience in estimation techniques and planning for software development projects.
Experience in effectively collaborating with wider non-agile teams.
Stakeholder management with statistics around tasks, backlog tracking, and burn down metrics, velocity, and user stories etc.
Exposure and experience with the SDLC; design, coding, test, build, QA, deployment, and maintenance and with service orientated architecture.
Demonstrable ability to self-manage, be proactive, take ownership, build relationships, and drive solutions through from inception to production.
Professional experience with tools such as Confluence, Jira, Rally are highly beneficial.

offer_title: Senior Software QA Engineer - C# - Civil Engineering Software
about: Become a member and participate in forming several new Software Engineering Scrum teams joining the Civil Infrastructure Product Line Group in Krakow. Our team develops Civil engineering software, like Autodesk Civil 3D, to help civil engineers during both the design and construction process. We are looking for someone that is passionate and committed to working in an Agile team, has great attention to detail, skilled in the testing of desktop software APIs or scripting API using C#, and the ability to create and execute test strategies for the validation of complex software. You have a customer focus and the ability to drive quality in a predictable manner. In this role, you will have a significant impact on how we design, build, and deliver our products to millions of professionals. You will work in a cross-functional team focused on building and maintaining software for various products and components. You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of unique challenges which give you the chance to learn modern technology and grow your skills. Tech that we use C#, C++ 17, Node, Docker, Python, AWS, Artifactory, CMake, Jenkins

Analyze and decompose a complicated software system and design a strategy to test it

Develop test strategies that are complete and concise
Perform functional testing, regression testing, ongoing system integration, and periodic build verification tests as part of each product release cycle
Find defects in features in development or products in production. Isolate, confirm, and log defects, and work with Agile Team to prioritize and fix them
Actively participate in Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, backlog grooming, sprint retrospective etc
Work with the Agile team at improving Quality Assurance processes and be an ambassador for quality
Identify redundant tests scenarios and work on their automation
requirements: Proficient in C# programming language
Working Experience or educational background in Civil Infrastructure industry
Passion to improve product quality
Customer orientated approach to Quality Assurance
Attention to detail
Some experience in software development in a commercial setting in a Scrum team
First or upper-second class degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field
Solid English knowledge

about: Wspólnie z naszym Partnerem, pionierem w branży finansowej, poszukujemy osoby na stanowisko Frontend Developer (Angular).✨ Nasz Partner to ceniony lider, zajmujący kluczową pozycję w sektorze finansów. offer_title: Embedded C/C++ Developer with Yocto – healthcare project
about: Are you an experienced Embedded (C/C++) Developer with Yocto expertise? Join an exciting healthcare project for a global leader in molecular diagnostics, known for cutting-edge in-vitro diagnostic solutions and data-driven clinical support tools. This role focuses on optimizing Linux systems for routers that connect diagnostic instruments to a cloud-based platform, enabling real-time data analysis and remote services. At Sii, a company recognized as a Great Place to Work, we offer long-term partnerships, career growth opportunities, and access to innovative projects across various industries. Apply today to make a difference in the future of healthcare!

Ensuring compliance with medical-grade software development standards and documentation practices
requirements: Minimum 4 years of experience in embedded software development, with at least 2 years using Yocto 2+

Hands-on experience with Linux kernel, driver development, and related tools
Proficiency in Python or a similar scripting language
Excellent English communication skills and availability for hybrid work at the Wrocław office

about: Are you passionate about evolving and revolutionising HR technology? Join Groupon as our HRIS Integration Specialist to design, develop and test various types of Workday integrations. The role requires interaction with other internal (Finance, HR, IT and Payroll) and external team members, responding to requests and providing integrated solutions. We are looking for an energetic, highly analytical, and creative problem solver to join Groupon’s Human Resources Information Systems Team (HRIS). As the HRIS Integration Specialist you will support and maintain Workday Integrations and help support other Workday modules, contributing to a great employee and manager experience. You will be responsible for the overall gathering of system requirements and working with the business to ensure focus on providing solutions in their assigned functional areas of Workday to meet business needs. The new member will be responsible for configuration of Workday HCM solution, testing and troubleshooting.
duties: As a HRIS Integration Specialist, you will join our team to design, develop and test various types of Workday integrations
The role requires interaction with other internal (Finance, HR, IT and Payroll) and external team members, responding to requests and providing integrated solutions
We work in an agile, flexible approach to defining business requirements and deliverables
Develop and test integrations within the Workday architecture
Review and translate business specifications and change requests into requirements and technical specifications
Understand and follow defined integration/development standards and best practices
Leverage Agile framework principles and follow project methodologies
Understand and ensure data security, privacy and data quality in integrations is maintained
Design, develop, and maintain integrations using the latest Workday tools such as Workday Studio, EIB (Enterprise Interface Builder), Core Connectors, PICOF/PACOF, and Workday Integration Cloud.
Collaborate with internal teams and external vendors to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Create detailed technical design documents, ensuring adherence to best practices and Workday’s integration standards.
Manage and monitor integration performance, ensuring all processes run efficiently and troubleshooting any issues that arise.
Implement and support APIs (SOAP, REST) to integrate Workday with third-party applications.
Maintain data integrity, ensuring that data is accurately synced between Workday and other systems, including HCM, payroll, finance, and other associated modules.
Provide ongoing support and maintenance of existing integrations, addressing any updates or new requirements that arise.
Stay up-to-date with Workday’s latest release features and evaluate how they can be leveraged for improving integration processes.
Work closely with stakeholders to provide guidance on data mapping, transformation, and validation processes.
Perform unit testing, system integration testing, and support UAT (User Acceptance Testing) for all Workday integrations.
Utilize Workday’s latest tools for reporting and analytics to improve the visibility of integration performance and system health.
Ensure that all integration solutions are scalable, secure, and compliant with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.
requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in relevant technical field (Information Technology, Computer Science, Software, Engineering, or related technical discipline) or equivalent combination of training and work experience
5 plus experience as Workday Integration Development
Proven experience with integrations: Have a deep understanding of how Workday connects to other business systems, and how to manage data flow, security, and synchronization
Proficiency in Workday Studio, EIBs, Core Connectors, Workday Web Services (WWS), and Workday Integration Cloud.
Strong knowledge of API integration technologies including SOAP and REST, as well as the latest Workday API updates.
Experience with XSLT, XML, JSON, and other data transformation tools.
Experience working with Workday Extend to customize integrations and build custom applications when needed.
Familiarity with Workday’s newest features such as Workday Prism Analytics, Workday Extend, and Workday Orchestrate.
Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex integration issues.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Knowledge of security standards in SaaS and cloud-based environments, particularly within Workday.
Experience in system integration testing, data validation, and error handling.
3+ years of experience with Workday functional configuration across three or more HCM modules such as Core HR, Compensation, Benefits Payroll, Absence and Time-Tracking is highly desirable.
3+ years of experience with cross-functional Workday administration including roles, permissions and security design and business process management.
2+ years of experience in HRIS project management including analysis, stakeholder engagement, and documentation. .
Proven experience handling confidential and sensitive information.
Ability to understand and react quickly to changing priorities
Compliance experience in PII, GDPR, SOX preferred.
Workday certification is a plus
Strong understanding of Workday modules especially Core HR, Recruiting, Time and Absence, Payroll, Business Processes, Organizational Hierarchies and Integrations Security
Experience working with Workday Payroll in-house and/or Workday solutions integrated with third party payroll providers. PECI/PICOF experience is preferred
Experience developing Workday integrations (EIB, Core Connectors, Advanced Custom Reports and Document Transforms) is mandatory
Experience in building integrations using Workday Web services and APIs (WSDL, SOAP, REST and WS standards)
Experience working in XML, XSLT, Workday Custom Reports and Workday Custom Objects, BIRT
Experience in automation tools and programming languages outside of Workday space (MS Power Apps, SQL, HTML)

about: Digital & Technology Team (D&T) is an integral division of HEINEKEN Global Shared Services Center. We are committed to making Heineken the most connected brewery. That includes digitalizing and integrating our processes, ensuring best-in-class technology, and embedding a data-driven culture. By joining us you will work in one of the most dynamic and innovative teams and have a direct impact on building the future of Heineken! Would you like to meet the Team, see our office and much more? Visit our website: Heineken (heineken-dt.pl). This role is part of the D&T department of HEINEKEN International and is located in Heineken Global Shared Service. D&T is proud to bring cutting-edge innovation, strong technology and advanced analytics to HEINEKEN. With speed and agility we ensure HEINEKEN has the technological competitive advantages it needs to deliver on its ambition. The Senior Data Quality Specialist role is critical in Heineken to operationalise our strategy to measure and improve data quality across the enterprise. We are looking for an experienced data quality professional to actively contribute to the implementation of services for data quality monitoring, reporting framework, and data quality lifecycle management. The role holder will work with colleagues across Heineken to implement, and mature, our approach to how data quality is measured and visualised. This will include facilitating our Design Reference Groups for DQ, engaging with colleagues from our operating companies and tracking of continuous improvement actions and progress. This role also includes managing DQ related projects & team members (external & internal). Success will require that the role holder own these processes and become an ambassador for co-creation and collaboration. A core goal of our data quality service is to provide operating companies with the insight they need to remediate data quality issues. Additionally, functions running strategic programmes require the ability to more accurately understand and plan for the work required to get data ready for change. The role holder will provide services to support these outcomes. The role holder will also work with colleagues from our business and subject matter experts to identify new and evolving data quality requirements needed to deliver targeting metrics. Maturing our DQ services will require that the role holder work collaboratively also with technology specialists to understand new functionality of the tools that we use and track implementation of enhancements.
duties: supporting defining DQ strategy & roll out plan for the DQ Factory
collection of DQ demand based on OpCos, business & functional owner requirements to address the most critical business issues
translating the business needs into actionable plans on how to improve DQ
prioritizing projects vs resources & propose DQ agenda & planning

liasing with business, functional owners & SMEs to be a point of contact for all DQ related topics

operationalizing our data quality services by developing, continuously improving and extending processes and procedures (local, regional and global) for data quality monitoring by embedding use of new DQ tooling and PowerBI dashboards for detection and monitoring of data quality issues
establishing and running operational delivery of KPIs for data quality that are accurate, efficient, fact based, and in line with defined timelines

about: Do you want to join client centric teams, work on innovative projects based on new technologies, apply dev craftmanship practices within a stimulating, kind and digital environment? Join the Origination program! The aim of this program is to ease the origination process of deals for the structured finance department. It includes structuration of the deals, their pricing, the management of all regulatory processes as well as addressing reporting needs that help Front Officers take their decision. There are 6 teams working on Origination program. These teams are client centric and are fully autonomous feature teams working on the same application (Origination Platform), each with their own backlog. We follow Agile SCRUM methodology. Within the team, your mission will mainly consist of developing new features, conducting new projects and ensuring support activities on web application aligned with digital transformation principles of the Société Générale Group. Technical Stack Practices

about: Elevate our IT transformation initiatives by enhancing our IT controlling capabilities and implementing robust Technology Business Management (TBM) practices. Drive financial transparency, optimize, manage and report on IT costs. Your engagement will be instrumental in setting up the Technology Business Management (TBM) framework, refining recharging mechanisms, and fostering a practice of financial discipline to support our organization's growth. As an early joiner, you will be able to strengthen the function within the IT organization.
duties: Reporting: Prepare, analyze and explain monthly and yearly internal reporting
Prepare, administer, analyze and explain budgets for major IT projects and programs, ensuring rigorous project cost tracking.
Perform IT investment analysis, ROI assessments, and contribute to business case development.
Produce comprehensive IT program reports for executive leadership, presenting financial data with clarity and precision.
Contribute to financial processes within the company.
Setup and advising: Implement robust financial reporting and KPI tracking for our IT organization, ensuring financial transparency and accountability.
Design and manage IT service recharge models to ensure precise cost allocation and recovery.
Identify and execute strategies for IT cost optimization and efficiency.
Lead the setup and integration of TBM practices across the organization, ensuring IT investments align with business value.
Develop comprehensive business case models to support IT project funding decisions and demonstrate value.
Implement and monitor IT cost control measures to maintain financial discipline and achieve budget targets.
Identify opportunities for improvement.
requirements: Master’s degree in finance or computer science, dual Master is strong plus.

Relevant certifications such as Certified Technology Business Management Executive (CTBME), Certified Technology Business Management Professional (CTBMP), or Certified IT Finance Manager (CITFM) are highly desirable.
Extensive experience in IT costing and financial project/program/portfolio management.
Proven track record in IT project and program control.
Expertise in IT service recharge modeling and IT benchmarks.
Deep understanding of Technology Business Management (TBM) and its application in aligning IT investments with business strategy.
Strong analytical skills and experience with IT investment analysis and ROI assessments.
Ability to operate with minimal supervision and take ownership of complex projects.
Strong communication skills, comfortable engaging with executive and C-level stakeholders.
Strategic thinker with a proactive approach to identifying opportunities for cost optimization and efficiency.
Experienced in working within a financially driven, international, private equity-backed organization.
Demonstrated ability to generate and present comprehensive financial reports for senior leadership.

about: Tribe Aplikacji Operacyjnych w Pionie CIO rozwija i utrzymuje aplikacje wspierające procesy operacyjne w banku. W naszym portfolio znajdują się: system centralny banku, centrum wiedzy o kliencie, procesy onboardingu klienta oraz aplikacje operacyjne do zarządzania danymi, przechowywania i archiwizacji dokumentów, automatyzacji procesów wewnętrznych oraz aplikacje kartowe. Oprócz tego, odpowiadamy także za rozwój i utrzymanie systemów z obszaru Zarządzania Danymi. Tworzymy Hurtownie Danych i narzędzia Business Intelligence, które umożliwiają efektywne gromadzenie, przetwarzanie i analizę danych. Naszym celem jest zapewnienie odpowiedniej struktury danych oraz dostępności informacji, umożliwiających trafne decyzje biznesowe. Na co dzień rozwijamy i utrzymujemy korporacyjną hurtownię danych, która składa się z ponad 450 faktów, 200 wymiarów, ponad 5000 tabel. Nasze rozwiązanie jest źródłem danych dla krytycznych procesów operacyjnych i biznesowych w Banku oraz dla rozwiązań sztucznej inteligencji. Będziesz pracować w zespole specjalistów którzy odpowiadają za efektywne wykorzystanie danych w ramach hurtowni danych. Będziesz brał udział w nowych inicjatywach biznesowych oraz transformacji do nowych rozwiązań technologicznych. Stack: Oracle, IBM Infosphere Data Stage, PL\SQL, Linux, bash, Java

about: Revolut Technology team isn’t just one of the best in the industry, it’s one of the best in the world. And we’re proud of it. It’s our driving force; our engine 🚀 From building a new banking backend to creating an award-winning app, there’s nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can’t do. Our Technology team isn’t here to fix legacy systems – it’s here to build world-class financial products from the ground up. Products that will be used by millions of people around the world 🌎 You may expect our Python Engineers to work on heavily regulated banking systems, but we love the unexpected. We’re actually better known internally for writing high-quality code and building complex novel solutions end-to-end 🧠 Revolut People platform is the engine behind Revolut’s historic growth from 2,000 employees in 2020 to over 5,000 employees in 2022. However, we’re not stopping there. Driving Revolut’s hyper-growth was only a proving ground for what’s to come. Now embarking on a journey to create a revolutionary HCM tool for companies globally –and for this to happen we need a superstar Engineer. A real Python MVP, who’ll help us to build the next generation employee management tool. If you’re passionate about creating reliable and exclusive software, while deepening your knowledge on the next HR SaaS disruptor - you know what to do! 👇

offer_title: Independent Model Review Specialist, Model Risk Management
company: HSBC Service Delivery (Polska) Sp. z o.o.
about: Model Risk Management (MRM) at HSBC is structured as a global function, headed up by the Chief Model Risk Officer (CMRO). The MRM function reports directly to the Group Chief Risk and Compliance Officer (GCRCO) ensuring its independence from the model developing and owning areas of the firm. MRM are the second line of defence (2LoD) for Model Risk and the CMRO is the global Model Risk Steward for the group and is also accountable for the global operation of the MRM function. MRM teams are based in each region, to ensure local subject matter expertise and to guide, review, and challenge. MRM activity is managed on a global basis as many models are used in multiple locations. This enables MRM to operate consistently and efficiently globally, and to take account of additional local regulatory requirements. Independent Model Validation is a specialist quantitative role within the Model Risk Management team responsible for carrying out independent validations of HSBC’s model landscape, to identify and communicate model limitations and issues. This role is part of the Markets Front Office & Product Control validation team. Independent Model Validation provides independent challenge of a model’s underlying theoretical assumptions and limitations, its practical implementation, its live application, and business usage, providing stakeholders (including model users, senior management, audit and regulators) with assurance that models and tools developed, maintained and used within HSBC Group are fit for their intended purposes and are compliant with applicable internal and supervisory expectations. They will also review remediation plans and activities, undertake portfolio level reviews across model types and challenge the model owners on the appropriate application of relevant policy of models.
duties: Undertake model validation and testing activities as dictated by the Global Model Risk Policy including the assessment of; model inputs, calculations, reporting outputs, conceptual soundness of the underlying theory and the suitability of the use for its intended purpose, relevance and completeness of data, qualitative information and judgements, documentation, and implementation of the model.
Provide written reports detailing the results of validations highlighting issues identified during the validation.
Communicate technical model related information and results to Model Owners and Model Users through the course of a validation.
Contribute to management, regulatory, and external confidence in all models used across the group.
requirements: Master’s or PhD degree in a quantitative discipline like Financial Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Quantitative Finance, Economics or Engineering.
Knowledge in one or more of the following areas: Stress Testing and Scenario Analysis models, Traded Risk and Pricing Models, Global Markets Trading & Hedging models, Asset Liability Models, etc.
Knowledge of statistical model and scorecard development techniques.
Knowledge of Risk models, performance metrics and risks and associated issues.
Some knowledge of internal procedures and local regulations and those of other country regulators would be an advantage.
Experience with some statistical modelling software / programming language e.g. SAS, Python, R, Matlab, C++, VBA.
Experience of developing and reviewing models throughout the customer lifecycle.
Experience of conducting independent model reviews is beneficial.

about: Are you a problem solver who really likes to dive into complex systems? Are you also good at creating good customer relations and you like working in a strong team? Consafe Logistics is now looking for Application Support Consultants to our Customer Service in Warsaw – people who will ensure that our large global customers are working smoothly using our systems! ABOUT SERVICE DESK As an Application Support Consultant you will work closely with our customers to always provide them with high quality support and service 24/7. We are looking both for experienced support specialists as well as junior candidates with a problem-solving attitude, motivated to provide great customer experience. Depending on your experience, you can work on problems with different degrees of difficulty. At Consafe Logistics you will work in a culture characterized by diversity, innovation, and transparency. We work with large global customers whose challenge lies in streamlining their logistics flows. You will get the opportunity to get a deep understanding of warehouse management and grow professionally while solving more and more difficult problems. We believe in long term relationships, both with customers and employees.
duties: As an Application Support Consultant, you will investigate and solve our customers' incidents, investigate root cause and will be responsible for the actions taken and help our customers at the start of a project.

You will work with time-consuming issues that really make use of your ability to both look into the details and see the big picture, as well as creating good relationships and build trust with the customers.
You will contribute to the successful and efficient support process by providing adequate information for first, second and third line investigation and location of the problem.
requirements: High troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
Great communication skills.
Strong customer focus.
Good understanding of computer systems, mainly Windows and SQL.
Understanding of logistics, logistics equipment and case management systems.
Bachelor degree in IT, engineering or similar field.
Fluency in Polish and English.
Openness to shift work.
Availability to hybrid work (3 days weekly of office work and 2 days weekly of remote work, in case of daily shifts).

about: We are looking for a Senior Python Developer to be a part of the DEVTALENTS team and contribute to the development of truly amazing solutions for businesses all over the world. We provide top projects for which recruitment is not possible externally because of our wide range of partners. We value open and transparent communication, leveraging tools like Slack and generative AI to enhance collaboration and efficiency. about: Without our Product team, there'd be no Revolut. Each one of our features started here, in the hands of our creative and innovative Product team members, and all our future ones will too 🚀 This team’s scope is wide — leading on the integration of engineering, data science, operations, and design — to continue changing the way the world does money. We’re looking for a Product Owner who knows how to take responsibility over the roadmap of their product, including day-to-day operations, project execution, and addressing risks. From conception to launch and beyond, you’ll collaborate cross-functionally and communicate with senior management to be the go-to person for your product. If you have an entrepreneurial passion and drive to never settle, we’d like to hear from you.
duties: Setting your team's goals, success metrics, and roadmap to align with Revolut’s mission
Driving maximum impact for your product based on data analysis, market research, and company strategy
Completely owning your team's products and features, from ideation, through development, to launch, growth, and maintenance
Having technical discussions with engineers regarding approaches, requirements, etc.
Collaborating with other stakeholders, such as FinCrime, Legal, and Security teams
requirements: 2+ years of experience working with a high-growth tech company or in banking/finance-related business areas (acquiring, payments, cryptocurrency, insurance, etc.)
2+ years of experience working on technical products (platforms, distributed systems, data science, machine learning, computer vision, robotics, etc.)
1 year of experience managing people (Product Owners at Revolut directly manage Engineering, Operations, and Design)
Outstanding written and oral communication skills
High analytical and technical acumen along with solid business sense that guides ROI-based prioritisation
Experience formulating and driving a focused product vision, and owning the narrative with leadership, customers, and partners
A bias towards action and bootstrapping major projects, rolling up your sleeves and being hands-on
Experience developing and launching products from scratch
The ability to provide insight and deliver measurable results for sophisticated products under ambiguous situations in a fast-paced environment

about: Imagine being part of one of the most supportive communities you will encounter in your professional career. Imagine the company where ‘teamwork’ is not just a buzzword, but one of the core values of each employee. Imagine the place with huge emphasis on building own services using the quality-focused engineering practices and cloud-first principles. The place where you can become great at things you’re currently good at. All that while maintaining work‑life balance. The ‘Odds Tribe’ in Sportradar offers popular trading services, used by 500+ organizations worldwide. Our team of experts manage betting probabilities using our leading edge mathematical models. Our clients can control their own sportsbooks in web interfaces, configuring everything from event and odds creation to market monitoring and result confirmation. At Sportradar, we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture and community. We partner with organizations and serve a customer base that is widely diverse. To best meet the needs of our partners and customers, we believe in ensuring our current and future employees feel empowered to bring forward their unique selves, opinions and viewpoints. Join our team and become a part of the global, fast-growing success.
duties: Use ATDD/BDD techniques in your daily work.
Use AWS, Kubernetes, and GitLab CI.
Build high performance services/products on top of our real-time sports data collected 24/7 globally for more than 30 different sports.
A real opportunity to influence the design and technology.
Take an active part in making the most out of our AWS partnership.
Become a domain expert in the exciting world of real-time hi-tech sports data.
requirements: Engineering leadership skills where people see you as a role model.
A test-first mindset where your values are aligned with engineering quality practices.
Strong programming skills enabling you to deliver software with high performance, availability, and throughput.
Experience with object-oriented programming languages such as Java or C++ and clean code/architecture principles.
A personal interest in keeping up with the general trends of software product development.
A can-do attitude, take pride in own work and an ability to keep up momentum.
Worked in Agile development teams.
Cloud based services from AWS.
Distributed systems.
Message queuing (RabbitMQ, Kafka).
Docker, Kubernetes.
Protobuf & GRPC.

about: We are expanding our newly established software team in Kraków, dedicated to developing robust ecosystem of "Service" applications for technicians who maintain electrical equipment in factories and their managers who plan and oversee their work. These applications will help track installation status, assess the condition of equipment, plan maintenance and perform safety operations. Our system aims to prevent blackouts and ensure machines remain operational. As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you will play a critical role in shaping and managing the Azure DevOps pipelines and releases that power our entire suite of Service applications. Your responsibilities will include overseeing the infrastructure, administrating Linux machines, and optimizing Azure resources, including Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters. You will also be responsible for creating and managing Helm charts to ensure consistent and efficient deployment processes. While your primary focus will be on the Azure environment, experience with Cyber Security topics and Terraform will be a valuable asset, further strengthening our commitment to security and infrastructure as code. We are looking for a proactive individual who is not just interested in running projects but in building and sustaining a robust, high-quality product ecosystem.
duties: Manage and optimize Azure resources, including PaaS services, databases, storage, networks, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), and Key Vault
Design, implement, and maintain Azure DevOps CI/CD pipelines and manage release processes across various environments
Oversee containerization efforts, working with Docker and Kubernetes to deploy and manage applications efficiently. Knowledge of Terraform and IaaS concept is nice to have
Administer Linux machines and Kubernetes clusters, ensuring their security, performance, and availability
Develop and maintain shell scripts in Bash/Python to automate routine tasks and enhance system functionality
Collaborate with development teams to ensure seamless integration and deployment of code, leveraging Git for version control
Ensure adherence to best practices in infrastructure management, focusing on security, scalability, and reliability. Knowledge of Cyber Security standards and best practices is a plus
requirements: University degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
5+ years of professional experience in DevOps, with a focus on Azure resources and cloud infrastructure
Strong expertise in managing Azure services, including PaaS, databases, storage, networks, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) and others
Proficiency in Azure DevOps, including Git repositories, CI/CD pipelines and release management. Knowledge of Terraform and IaaS concept is a plus
Solid experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes. Knowledge of Cyber Security and best practices is a plus
Hands-on experience in administering Linux machines and shell scripting in Bash/Python
Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills, strong written and spoken communication skills in English

duties: Administering and managing the Office 365 environment, including services such as Exchange Online, Microsoft Defender, Proofpoint, IronPort, Exchange on-premises (2016/2019), and archiving solutions like Enterprise Vault.

Monitoring and reporting on service performance, identifying issues, and taking corrective actions.

Training users and teams on new features and tools available within Microsoft 365.
requirements: Minimum 2 years of experience as an Office 365 Administrator or in a similar role.
Excellent knowledge of Office 365 services, including Exchange Online, SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams, and user and license management.
Knowledge of Microsoft 365 security management (e.g., security policies, data management, Microsoft Defender).

Good communication skills and ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams.
Good command of French and English (at least B2 level).

offer_title: Data Integration Developer (ETL, RESTful API, CI/CD)
duties: ETL Development and Maintenance:
Design, develop, and maintain ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into target systems.
Optimize ETL workflows to enhance performance and data accuracy.
Monitor and troubleshoot ETL jobs to ensure successful data processing.
System Integration:
Develop and implement system integration solutions to ensure seamless data flow between disparate systems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify integration requirements and design integration solutions.
Maintain and enhance integration platforms and middleware to support business needs.
RESTful API Development:
Design, develop, and maintain RESTful APIs to facilitate data exchange between systems.
Ensure APIs are secure, scalable, and well-documented.
Implement API testing and monitoring to ensure reliability and performance.
CI/CD Implementation:
Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate the build, test, and deployment processes.
Ensure integration and ETL solutions are continuously delivered with high quality.
Collaborate with DevOps teams to optimize deployment workflows and toolchains.
Data Management:

We are a team of around 70 people located in New York, Toronto, Hong Kong, Guangzhou, London and Krakow. about: We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. about: We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join a renowned American apparel brand. In this role, you'll enhance consumer experiences by identifying improvement opportunities and prototyping solutions. You'll collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and engineers to develop and deploy ML models for e-commerce sites, in-store portals, and mobile apps, driving personalized consumer experiences. Project information:
duties: Implement end-to-end solutions for batch and real-time algorithms along with requisite tooling around monitoring, logging, automated testing, model retraining, model deployment and metadata tracking
Identify new opportunities to improve business processes and improve consumer experiences, and prototype solutions to demonstrate value with a crawl, walk, run mindset.
Work with data scientists and analysts to create and deploy new product features on the e-commerce website, in-store portals, and mobile app
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for data analyses, model development, validation and implementation
Write efficient and scalable software to ship products in an iterative, continual-release environment
Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team and build cloud-native software for ML pipelines
Contribute to and re-use community best practices
Embody the values and passions with empathy to engage with colleagues from multiple backgrounds
requirements: University or advanced degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related field.
7+ years in software development, with strong experience in developing and deploying ML systems in large data science environments.
Proficient in Python, with tools like VSCode and Jupyter Notebooks; familiarity with Java, C++, or Scala is a plus.
Experienced with big data tools (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka) and cloud platforms, preferably GCP with serverless architecture.
Expertise in CI/CD processes using GitHub Actions, Harness, Jenkins.
Skilled in data warehousing (Google BigQuery) and independently managing Kubeflow pipelines.
Knowledgeable in feature engineering, feature stores, and audit processes.
Strong foundation in software engineering practices, including testing, CI, code reviews, and documentation.
Experience with ML orchestration systems (Kubeflow, Step Functions, ML Flow, Airflow, TFX) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
Strong reasoning to balance solution vs risk taking

about: The Solution Architect completes detailed solution designs for stories within the product backlog. Their primary stakeholders are product owners, fellow Architects (Enterprise Architect, Data, Platform, Process and Business) and pod members. They are accountable for defining the solution design, in alignment with the technology strategy and roadmap, and articulating associated architectural risks, issues and technical debt. The Solution Architect may also provide architectural leadership across a portfolio of change. *We are looking for Poland based candidate. The job is remote.
duties: Accountable for ensuring the products & services are supported by the right architectures and solutions meet the customer needs.
Accountable for ensuring the design of the product solutions are cost effective and maintained through the agile development lifecycle, managing the flow of the backlog of design activities.

Convert requirements into actionable product/service requirements that feed Technology and/or data solutions development & influence service direction.

Responsible for ensuring solutions are aligned with the platform architecture and roadmap, group standards and policies, reference architectures and the overall enterprise architecture for their function.

Nasz zespół pracuje w międzynarodowych strukturach grupy Schwarz i dostarcza rozwiązania BI dziesiątkom tysięcy użytkowników w ponad 30 krajach.
duties: Rozwój i utrzymanie aplikacji Business Intelligence zbudowanych w oparciu o platformę MicroStrategy.
Rozwój i utrzymanie hurtowni danych z wykorzystaniem platformy Snowflake.
Analiza i przygotowywanie danych na potrzeby aplikacji analitycznych i rozwiązań raportujących BI.
Identyfikacja i zbieranie wymagań biznesowych, przeprowadzanie analizy wykonalności i zarządzanie oczekiwaniami właścicieli produktów.
Współpraca z analitykami, architektami, programistami i konsultantami oraz koordynacja działań na wielu poziomach w organizacji.
Doradztwo w obszarze Business Intelligence w celu optymalizacji rozwiązań Self-Service BI i zapewnienia bieżącego wsparcia klientom wewnętrznym.
requirements: Ukończyłeś/aś studia wyższe informatyczne lub inne ścisłe (np. ekonomiczne) uzupełnione o szkolenia z zakresu IT.

Posiadasz co najmniej 3 lata doświadczenia w pracy w obszarze Business Intelligence jako developer z wykorzystaniem platformy MicroStrategy (znajomość innych narzędzi BI mile widziana, ale nie wymagana).

Posiadasz co najmniej 3 lata doświadczenia w pracy z bazami danych z dobrą znajomością SQL i przynajmniej jednego systemu chmurowych lub relacyjnych baz danych (mile widziane: Snowflake, Google BigQuery, Teradata, Oracle).
Potrafisz interpretować wymagania biznesowe, cechuje Cię umiejętność analitycznego myślenia i rozwiązywania problemów.
Cenisz sobie pracę z innymi, a komunikacja wewnątrz zespołu jak i z klientem wewnętrznym to dla Ciebie przyjemność.
Znasz język angielski na poziomie swobodnego porozumiewania się i omawiana zagadnień biznesowych (min. B2/C1).
Chcesz dalej z nami rozwijać swoje umiejętności.
Umiejętność zaawansowanego programowania w SQL, optymalizacji zapytań i modelowania danych.
Umiejętność programowania w Python i/lub JavaScript.
Doświadczenie w pracy z zastosowaniem metodologii Agile.
Umiejętność pracy z narzędziami Azure DevOps, Jira, Confluence.
Znajomość języka niemieckiego.

about: Wspólnie z naszym Partnerem, liderem w transformacji cyfrowej w branży finansowej, poszukujemy osoby na stanowisko Analityka Biznesowo- Systemowego ✨ Projekt ma na celu stworzenie nowego procesu otwierania rachunków firmowych dla klientów z sektora SME (Small and Medium Enterprises). Rozwiązanie to ma stanowić alternatywę lub uzupełnienie dla obecnie dostępnych metod – zarówno w oddziałach, jak i w kanałach zdalnych. Realizacja prac projektowych została przewidziana na marzec
duties: Uczestnictwo w cyklu wytwarzania oprogramowania, obejmującym wszystkie etapy: od założeń biznesowych, przez projektowanie i rozwój, aż po testy i wdrożenie,
Zarządzanie wymaganiami i dbałość o jakość dokumentacji, zapewniając możliwość śledzenia ich powiązań oraz efektywnego zarządzania zmianami,
Prowadzenie analiz systemowych z naciskiem na budowę, utrzymanie i rozwój produktów oraz procesów,
Dopracowywanie ostatecznego kształtu produktu w ścisłej współpracy z biznesem.
requirements: Minimum 5-letnie doświadczenie komercyjne na stanowisku Analityka,
Projektowanie rozwiązań oraz tworzenie dokumentacji systemowej z wykorzystaniem notacji UML i BPMN,
Doświadczenie w pracy z narzędziem Enterprise Architect,
Doświadczenie w branży bankowej - MUST HAVE❗
Dobra znajomość języka angielskiego,
Praktyczna znajomość SQL.

about: We are looking for a Senior Pentester (Security Engineer) to be a part of the DEVTALENTS team and contribute to the development of truly amazing solutions for businesses all over the world. Joining DEVTALENTS can be a life-changing decision for you, with endless benefits along the way. We provide top projects for which recruitment is not possible externally because of our wide range of partners. We value open and transparent communication, leveraging tools like Slack and generative AI to enhance collaboration and efficiency. We support continuous growth, encouraging you to step beyond your comfort zone and develop technically and personally. We are looking for an experienced Senior Pentester (Security Engineer) to join our team and provide technical leadership and mentorship.
duties: Conduct in-depth penetration tests (white-box and black-box) on both internal and customer-facing applications, services, and infrastructure.
Oversee, prioritize, and analyze bug bounty submissions, as well as findings from external penetration tests.
Perform variant analysis on disclosed vulnerabilities across multiple platforms and frameworks.
Investigate and review third-party solutions to ensure they meet our security standards.
Create and refine tools for reconnaissance, process automation, and ongoing metrics and performance tracking.
Offer expert advice to engineering and security operations teams, providing clear remediation strategies and deeper insight into identified issues.
Promote offensive security principles by hosting demos, workshops, and training sessions, building a stronger security-minded culture.
Evaluate our technology stack through the most effective methods available, adapting your approach as the environment evolves.
Determine priorities and focus areas to maximize value and impact.
Contribute significantly to the ongoing development and maturity of our security program.
requirements: Proven track record in penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, and other technical security evaluations.
Strong ability to find, understand, and articulate security flaws in code, particularly in Java and Node.js environments.
Hands-on experience with cloud infrastructures, especially AWS, and familiarity with modern microservice-oriented architectures.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of clearly conveying findings and suggesting pragmatic, targeted improvements rather than merely reporting issues.
Comfortable scripting in Python and contributing to more extensive security tooling or automation projects.
Self-driven, with the initiative to spearhead projects that strengthen the broader security culture and foundations.
Hold one or more reputable industry certifications (e.g., OSCP, OSWE, CREST, GIAC, AWS certifications).
Active participant in CTFs and the broader cybersecurity community, staying current on emerging threats and best practices.
Higher education with a profile in Computer Science or related
English level min. B2.

about: We are now looking for a Lead AI Engineer in UPM Sourcing to learn and grow with us. This is a permanent position, located in Helsinki / Tampere, Finland or in Wrocław, Poland.
duties: Lead AI development initiatives: Take ownership of technical AI development within your area of responsibility, ensuring alignment with strategic goals and business priorities

You are fluent in English and comfortable working in a global, multicultural environment; proficiency in additional languages is beneficial

Educational Background: You hold a Master’s Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Management Science, or Mathematics, providing a solid foundation for technical AI development
Relevant Experience: You possess 3-5 years of experience in a similar role within a global organization

AI and Data Expertise: You have strong experience in designing and implementing AI use cases, machine learning, generative AI frameworks, Large Language Models (LLMs), and architectures, building data pipelines, and performing related data engineering activities; proficiency in programming languages like SQL and Python is essential
Cloud Proficiency: You bring deep knowledge of cloud platforms, tools, and architecture, including Snowflake, SQL Server, Microsoft Azure AI and Data services

offer_title: BlackRock Aladdin SME / Data Analyst (Aladdin Studio Integration)
about: Our Client is a global leader in financial services, providing a wide range of products and services to individual, corporate, and institutional clients. The role involves working with a variety of stakeholders, including developers, QA engineers, product managers, and business owners, to ensure that releases are delivered on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards. The Client’s Mission is to serve as a trusted partner to their clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. They have set expectations for how they must act to bring their mission to life. These expectations are at the heart of the Leadership Principles – we take ownership, we deliver with pride and we succeed together. Maxima Consulting is an IT consulting company founded in 1993 in Boston. Our technology experts across North America, Europe, Asia, and Australia help organizations of all shapes and sizes in their digital transformation efforts. We provide practical and dependable solutions to the IT infrastructure, software development, quality assurance, maintenance & support, cybersecurity challenges, and a broad scope of additional services. Position Summary: We are looking for an experienced BlackRock Aladdin SME / Data Analyst with expertise in Aladdin Studio integration to drive data management, analysis, and system integration efforts within Citi Bank's asset management and portfolio operations. The ideal candidate will bring in-depth knowledge of the Aladdin platform, particularly in optimizing data flows and integrating Aladdin Studio with various business processes to ensure accurate and timely insights across our investment management operations.
duties: Act as the subject matter expert (SME) on the BlackRock Aladdin platform, providing guidance, training, and support across the business and technology teams.
Lead the design and implementation of Aladdin Studio integrations to ensure smooth data flow and process automation between Aladdin and Citi Bank’s internal systems.
Build and optimize custom workflows, reports, and dashboards using Aladdin Studio's analytical and programming capabilities.
Extract, transform, and analyze large datasets from Aladdin to support portfolio management, risk analysis, and compliance monitoring.

Configure and customize the Aladdin platform to meet Citi Bank’s business needs, including creating custom analytics, dashboards, and data pipelines. Ensure that all system configurations comply with best practices and regulatory requirements.
Work closely with portfolio managers, risk managers, IT teams, and data analysts to understand business needs and translate them into technical solutions within the Aladdin ecosystem.

Continuously improve Aladdin system performance by identifying opportunities to enhance workflows, automate processes, and streamline data integration efforts. Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues within the Aladdin platform.
Develop and maintain detailed technical documentation, including integration workflows, data mappings, and process guidelines.
Manage end-to-end projects related to Aladdin implementations and system enhancements.
Ensure the Aladdin platform and associated processes comply with regulatory requirements, and provide support for audits and regulatory reviews as needed.
requirements: 5+ years of experience working with the BlackRock Aladdin platform, with a strong focus on Aladdin Studio integration and data analytics.
Proven experience in financial services, particularly in asset management, portfolio management, or risk management functions.
Advanced proficiency with Aladdin Studio and its integration capabilities.
Strong experience in data analytics, particularly with SQL, Python, or similar programming languages for data manipulation and analysis.
Knowledge of API integration, ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, and data workflows.
Solid understanding of investment management, asset allocation, risk management, and regulatory compliance.
Familiarity with fixed income, equities, and derivatives trading and portfolio management processes.

about: Capacity management purpose: Bank has identified undesired non-financial risks outside risk appetite related to the ability of the bank to failover and run in the event of one data centre (DC) outage due to a physical event. Bank’s technical teams have identified technical limitations preventing the approved 2DC Mirroring architecture from working.2DC mirroring requires large amount of additional capacity from our Datacentres – mainly Space, Power, Cooling. Currently Datacentres are at capacity and new capacity will not be available in the size 2DC Mirroring requires. Bank is running at capacity limit for committed capacity for our Data Centers but has 20-30% potentially free capacity that can be free up. To install the new hardware, old one needs to be decommissioned to free up the Power (kW). Decommissioning old hardware requires time-consuming migration of currently installed applications to the new hardware and needs to be monitored and escalated by capacity management. Exec summary: Business analytics persons is required to support BCCM capacity manager with: 1. demand planning, governance setup/improvements, workshops, 2. facilitate and execute on the short term capacity free up initiatives. 3. facilitate and execute on the long term capacity free up initiatives. Role Description: This role will support BCCM WS4 capacity management project’s activities to ensure that they are delivered in a timely and appropriate manner.
duties: Identify data sources for capacity forecast
Establish communication channels to coordinate capacity requests and delivery
Collect capacity requirements from BCCM workstreams
Analyze the data and prepare short and long term forecast
Plan and co-ordinate capacity free up initiatives
Manage, monitor and report on the progress capacity delivery and free up initiatives
Create Capacity plan overviews for discussion and approval from key stakeholders
Ensure
requirements: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to gather and interpret complex data and work in Excel

about: At BBH, Partnership is more than a form of ownership—it’s our approach to business and relationships.  We know that supporting your professional and personal goals is the best way to help our clients and advance our business. We take that responsibility seriously. With a 200-year legacy and a shared passion for what’s next, this is the right place to build a fulfilling career. Brown Brothers Harriman is currently recruiting a Product Development Analyst to join our Infomediary Data Solutions organization. The Product Development Analyst is responsible for working with the Infomediary Data Solutions team to create and implement projects supporting the Data Services product roadmap. S/he will help ensure that the project design meets the goals and objectives of the project, satisfies all aspects of the project scope, and aligns with the overall Data Services strategy. The Product Development Analyst assists with project design, is responsible for managing definition / documentation of requirements, and focuses on ensuring integrity throughout all phases of the project life cycle and managing changes as required. The individual will work both independently and as part of a project team to actively analyze stakeholders needs and increase operational efficiency.
duties: Design and develop data services processes using SQL queries and reporting tools and ensure the seamless flow of data across various systems and databases.

Conduct business and system analysis to determine how changing business needs will affect the system or product; clearly articulate the business need and potential solutions with support of insightful analysis and documented evidence.

Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, configurations, and best practices. Write and/or review technical specification documentation which may include data modelling, dataflow diagramming, screen design, workflow analysis etc.
Learn and apply existing and emerging technology solutions to provide simplification, standardization and automation aiming scalability and or risk reduction.
Provide an enhanced client experience by anticipating client needs related to the project by initiating and recommending actions that will lead to the successful completion of the project.
Demonstrate strong subject matter expertise, including technical knowledge of associated systems.
Help to identify coding patterns and anti-patterns and enforce implementation of the patterns through code reviews.

Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including other data engineers, Systems Developers, analysts, Project Managers, and business stakeholders, to understand data requirements and deliver solutions.

Participate in all phases of testing, including user acceptance testing, regression testing, client testing and parallel/pilot testing, to validate that development meets the specifications of requirements and design and satisfies the project scope.
Participate in post project reviews and document lessons learned.
requirements: BA/BS degree, and/or equivalent work experience.
3+ years related work experience (analysis in software development projects is a plus). Financial services industry knowledge and experience preferred.
Ability to complete duties as assigned under minimal supervision.
Demonstrated ability to work in a team-oriented environment.
Proficiency using windows-based applications, including MS Office applications such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Access.
SQL experience and ability to write the queries and optimize existing ones is a plus.
Understanding of data modeling principles and application design experience.
Experience with product management methodologies and tools (Jira, Confluence).
Understanding of fund administration and of the key roles assumed by Custodians, Fund Accountants, Fund Administrators, and Transfer Agents is a plus.
Creative and effective problem-solving and analytical and organizational skills.
Proactive and results oriented.
Ability to understand and adapt to changing business priorities and technology advancements.
Experience with Data Fabric or related toolsets is a nice have.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with internal and external stakeholders.

offer_title: Senior DevOps Engineer for Samsung Ads Project
about: We seek a highly skilled and motivated DevOps engineers to join our growing Samsung Ads team in role of embedded Site Reliability Engineering (SRE). As SRE, you will lead development and buildout of components of Samsung’s DSP platform. As an embedded Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) you’ll be part of a software development team and act as a subject matter expert on the challenges of usability, performance, reliability, scalability and observability. The ideal candidate has deep knowledge and a strong interest in process automation, observability, software-defined infrastructure, and approaches it from the perspective of a software engineer. Challenges of globally distributed services, deciding what and when state should be shared, and simulating failure scenarios should drive you. Samsung Ads is a highly successful and fast-growing business for over last six years. This business and its continued future success depend on the products, technologies, and tools owned by Samsung. Hundreds of people strong, with a substantial presence in five countries, Samsung Ads team is a dynamic and complex organization operating across a broad spectrum of product and strategic domains. Join our team and play a key role in shaping the future of our ad tech platform. Technologies in use:
duties: Co-architect new services, including failure tolerance and self-healing by-design, as well as establishing clear scaling-out paths
Act as a subject matter expert for the challenges of infrastructure and operation within your team
Translate Product Owner requirements into actionable technical tasks
Advise on tuning observability systems to represent the health of the systems your team is responsible for and glean insights to plan for growth
Contribute to the global SRE practice
Empower your development team with tooling and automation, including CI/CD
Continuously improve internal services for ease of packaging, configuration, and deployment
Participate in shared on-call rotation
Evaluating and benchmarking new solutions, establishing capacity and growth plans
Developing and supporting usable and maintainable tooling for the engineering organization
Administration of services, whether built in-house or from external vendors
Continuous optimization of services on all layers (hardware, software) for high performance
Monitoring of all critical services, sharing pager duty, troubleshooting, and addressing problems as they arise (including any needed changes in code, topology, resources, or configuration)
Backup/DR implementation, plans, documentation, and exercises
Co-own technical relationships with several service providers and vendors
requirements: Strong expertise administrating and scaling Kubernetes on bare metal and AWS (CKA, CKAD, CKS are nice to have)
Relevant software engineering experience with at least one language (Go, Ruby, Python, Erlang or Java)
Strong understanding of distributed systems and client-server architectures
Strong Linux system administration and troubleshooting skills, including solid knowledge of how the various components work (kernel, CPU, memory, disk, network)
Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools (Terraform and custom modules)
Experience working in microservices environments
Capacity and willingness to work in an agile multi-team environment
Demonstrated ability to prioritize tasks and promptly resolve problems
Ability to work autonomously, multi-task, and work in a fast-paced environment
You have a track record of making things better and leading solutions that remove technical pain points and facilitate growth
You enjoy working with others who are intelligent and passionate about building practical, reliable, high-performance products
Excellent communication skills in English

The Project Manager is responsible for managing engagements, keeping them on track, maintaining their health, leading a team of delivery professionals and achieving customer satisfaction. In addition, the role involves keeping the project team working on the highest priority tasks, removing risks and impediments, maintaining financials on track and leading communications with all Stakeholders.

about: Sportradar is the leading global provider of sports data and entertainment products and services. Since 2001, we have occupied a unique position at the intersection of the sports, media and betting industries; providing sports federations, news media, consumer platforms and sports betting operators with a range of solutions to help grow their business. The Information Security group provides services to ensure confidentiality, integrity and availability of information and systems owned by Sportradar and its subsidiaries. The Product Security unit within Information Security works primary with the Engineering group to ensure that the products & services developed by its Tribes are Secure-by-Design and remain Secure-in-Production. This includes coaching developers on secure development practices, building products for our cloud environment that help developers prevent vulnerabilities and misconfigurations arising over time, and managing the attack surface so that engineers can focus their remediation efforts on the highest criticality vulnerabilities specific to Sportradar’s risk profile. We also run an external Bug-Bounty programme for in-scope applications, as well as a Security Champions community across Sportradar.
duties: Respond to identified vulnerabilities in our applications and cloud environments without jeopardizing product roadmap.
Evangelize and coach engineers on secure design & development practices through threat modelling and help remediate findings through pair-programming sessions.
Cross pollination of secure development techniques and best practices across engineering tribes.
Collaborate across both SSD and ASM teams in Product Security to ensure unit initiatives are successfully delivered.
Be on-hand to assist colleagues as part of our incident response process should this be required.
requirements: You get excited by challenges, and have a positive, can-do attitude in working with different teams, locations and technologies to achieve the best outcome.
You are interested in cloud and application security and thrive on having multiple problems to solve, together with a continuous learning mindset.
You enjoy diving in and figuring the crux of a problem quickly and helping provide a pragmatic solution to the team, whilst efficiently communicating the outcome to techies and managers alike.
You are comfortable with mentoring others and taking a lead role for an initiative to help deliver the intended outcomes.
Degree in software development, or other relevant experience.
10+ years of experience as a software developer or DevOps professional.
Ability to manage, prioritize, remediate vulnerabilities like those on the OWASP Top10 list.
Excellent knowledge in at least one of the object-orientated programming languages like Java, .NET, and scripting languages like Python, JavaScript, etc.
Experience with AWS cloud services, especially their security products.
Experience with modern technologies like Kubernetes, Protobuf, gRPC, and GraphQL.
Experience with automated deployments and containerized application management.
Experience with message brokers (e.g. Kafka), and relational databases (e.g. MySQL.
A keen interest in continuous professional learning across software engineering, cloud, and application security domains.
Working in agile development teams in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent inter-personal and communication skills with fluency in English (written & spoken).
Ability to take a lead role in the team, supervising and/or mentoring others.
Cloud-native development and/or experience with other public & hybrid cloud services (GCP, OCI, etc).
Hands-on experience with Cloud & Software Security and DevSecOps tooling such as CNAPP, SAST and SCA.
Experience with maintaining large-scale and fault-tolerant distributed systems in production.
Experience with test-driven development.

about: Imagine being part of one of the most supportive communities you will encounter in your professional career. Imagine the company where ‘teamwork’ is not just a buzzword, but one of the core values of each employee. Imagine the place with huge emphasis on building own services using the quality-focused engineering practices and cloud-first principles. The place where you can become great at things you’re currently good at. All that while maintaining work‑life balance. The ‘Odds Tribe’ in Sportradar offers popular trading services, used by 500+ organizations worldwide. Our team of experts manage betting probabilities using our leading edge mathematical models. Our clients can control their own sportsbooks in web interfaces, configuring everything from event and odds creation to market monitoring and result confirmation. At Sportradar, we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture and community. We partner with organizations and serve a customer base that is widely diverse. To best meet the needs of our partners and customers, we believe in ensuring our current and future employees feel empowered to bring forward their unique selves, opinions and viewpoints. Join our team and become a part of the global, fast-growing success.

requirements: Being supportive to people around and finding joy in inspiring others.

about: Our client is a leading global travel data provider, that has been powering the growth and innovation of the air travel ecosystem since 1929. Every day, they support millions of journeys across the globe, enabling a simpler, seamless, and more enjoyable travel experience. about: We are looking for a Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Architect to join Digital Hub Warsaw! Join Our Team as a Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Architect! Are you a visionary leader with a passion for shaping marketing technology strategies? As the Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Architect, you will be the cornerstone of our marketing automation team, guiding a group of talented developers and ensuring the successful implementation of innovative solutions. If you are ready to take on a leadership role and drive impactful marketing initiatives, we want to hear from you!
duties: Solution Architecture Leadership: Design and oversee the implementation of comprehensive end-to-end solutions within Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC), aligning marketing strategies with technological capabilities to enhance customer engagement.
Data Architecture Expertise: Lead the design of complex data models and segmentation strategies, ensuring optimal use of Data Extensions and Subscriber Models to support targeted marketing efforts.
API & Integration Oversight: Spearhead the integration of SFMC with Salesforce CRM and other platforms using REST and SOAP APIs, ensuring seamless data synchronization and enhanced customer journeys.
Team Development and Guidance: Mentor and develop a team of Marketing Cloud Developers, fostering a collaborative environment that encourages innovation and professional growth.
Cross-Channel Orchestration: Guide the team in creating cohesive customer experiences by aligning email, SMS, push, and social marketing channels to drive unified engagement.

Performance Optimization Strategies: Establish best practices for A/B testing, deliverability optimization, and campaign performance analysis, ensuring the team consistently delivers high-impact results.
Stakeholder Management: Collaborate with key stakeholders to gather business requirements, communicate architectural solutions, and manage expectations throughout project lifecycles.

Compliance and Security Leadership: Ensure adherence to data privacy regulations (GDPR, CCPA) and marketing compliance standards (CAN-SPAM, CASL), establishing protocols for data handling and user permissions.
requirements: You have extensive experience in Salesforce Marketing Cloud, with a strong focus on solution architecture and integration capabilities within the Salesforce ecosystem.
Deep understanding of SFMC modules like Email Studio, Contact Builder, Automation Studio, and Journey Builder.
Experience in integrating external data sources in Snowflake.
Good understanding of Salesforce product portfolio like Data Cloud and Health Cloud.
Familiarity with SQL, AMPscript, SSJS, HTML and CSS, especially for Emails.
You hold relevant certifications, such as Salesforce Marketing Cloud Architect or System Architect, and are committed to continuous learning in the rapidly evolving SFMC landscape.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (Computer Science, Marketing, or similar).

offer_title: Data Integration Developer (ETL, RESTful API, CI/CD)
duties: ETL Development and Maintenance:
Design, develop, and maintain ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into target systems.
Optimize ETL workflows to enhance performance and data accuracy.
Monitor and troubleshoot ETL jobs to ensure successful data processing.
System Integration:
Develop and implement system integration solutions to ensure seamless data flow between disparate systems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify integration requirements and design integration solutions.
Maintain and enhance integration platforms and middleware to support business needs.
RESTful API Development:
Design, develop, and maintain RESTful APIs to facilitate data exchange between systems.
Ensure APIs are secure, scalable, and well-documented.
Implement API testing and monitoring to ensure reliability and performance.
CI/CD Implementation:
Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate the build, test, and deployment processes.
Ensure integration and ETL solutions are continuously delivered with high quality.
Collaborate with DevOps teams to optimize deployment workflows and toolchains.
Data Management:
Ensure data quality, integrity, and consistency across systems.
Develop and enforce data governance policies and procedures.
Implement data validation and cleansing techniques to improve data reliability.
Support and Troubleshooting:
Provide support for data integration, ETL, API, and CI/CD issues, ensuring timely resolution.
Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective actions to prevent recurrence.
requirements: Proven experience in ETL development, system integration, RESTful API development, and CI/CD implementation.
Hands-on experience with ETL tools such as Informatica, Talend, or SSIS.
Experience with integration platforms and middleware technologies (e.g., MuleSoft, Dell Boomi).
Familiarity with data modeling, SQL, and database management systems.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Attention to detail and a commitment to quality.

about: Firmę Allmedica sp. z o.o. charakteryzuje bardzo dynamiczny rozwój zarówno w zakresie rozwoju sieci placówek jak również tworzonego oprogramowania i rozwiązań IT. W ostatnich latach firma aktywnie pracowała nad platformą do zarządzania placówką medyczną. Obecnie system jest aktywny i wdrożony w pierwszych placówkach. Jednocześnie prace nad nowymi funkcjonalnościami ciągle trwają. Osoba pracująca w zespole wdrożeniowym aktywnie uczestniczy w procesie wdrażania oprogramowania i wsparcia powdrożeniowego. Jej zadania obejmują nie tylko udział w implementacji systemu, lecz także zapewnienie wsparcia technicznego i funkcjonalnego użytkownikom po zakończeniu wdrożenia. Specjalista ds. wdrożenia będzie ponadto zaangażowany w procesy rozwoju oprogramowania, dzieląc się swoimi wskazówkami i sugestiami w celu ciągłego doskonalenia produktów oraz świadcząc wsparcie dla zespołu programistycznego w tworzeniu nowych funkcjonalności i rozwiązań informatycznych. Rozpoczynając pracę na stanowisku wdrożeniowca kluczowe jest posiadanie otwartej głowy i gotowość do nauki. Nasz zespół jest gotowy wspierać nowe osoby w zdobywaniu wiedzy i umiejętności, aby osiągnąć wysoki poziom specjalizacji w tych dziedzinach.
