about: Are you an innovative thinker with a passion for driving business performance into the future? We are looking for a Senior Supply Chain Business Analyst reporting to the Supply Chain Performance Manager to join our Global Excellence team. In this role, you will play a global role and leverage data, AI, and advanced analytics to enhance our supply chain strategy, drive efficiency, and empower data-driven decision-making. Join our Huntsman Advanced Materials division and bring your expertise in AI-driven analytics to make a substantial impact on our business performance. This role requires a unique combination of technical expertise and business acumen. We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Supply Chain Business Analyst in this newly created position.
duties: Executive Reporting: Create real-time, interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI to provide strategic insights, enabling stakeholders to make informed decisions.
AI-Driven Use Cases: Design and implement AI and machine learning models for supply chain optimization in areas like planning, inventory management, and risk mitigation.
Advanced Analytics & Scenario Planning: Utilize machine learning and advanced analytics for scenario planning, enhancing supply chain efficiency and optimizing inventory and cost structures.

Develop and Monitor KPIs: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics for our supply chain organization. Continuously assess and refine metrics based on feedback and evolving business needs.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with stakeholders to implement new processes and data-driven practices, ensuring alignment with company standards and promoting best practices across teams.
requirements: Bachelor's degree in business Analytics, Data Science, Supply Chain Management, or equivalent experience. A master's degree is preferred.
3-5+ years in business analytics or a similar role, with a focus on supply chain or operations.

Data Analysis & Visualization: Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Power BI and Azure Synapse Analytics for creating dashboards and visualizations. Knowledge of DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) for complex data manipulation is a plus.
Machine Learning & AI: Proficient in Azure Machine Learning (Azure ML) and Python for developing and deploying predictive models.
Data Engineering & ETL: Proficient in Azure Data Factory, SQL databases, and Azure Databricks for managing and transforming data pipelines.
Strong understanding of business operations and the ability to leverage data insights to meet business objectives.
Proven ability to manage projects, facilitate change, and deliver results in dynamic environments.
Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across functions and effectively communicate insights to a multicultural audience.
Familiarity with MRP tools and SAP is a plus.
Ability to collaborate with cross regional departments.

requirements: Over 2 years of experience in a similar role, managing workplace technology and end-user environments.
Knowledge of messaging services such as Exchange 2016, 2019, Office 365, Microsoft Defender, Proofpoint, Ironport, Archive Exchange, Archive Enterprise Vault.

about: We are looking for a .Net Full-Stack Developer to build Middleware APIs and Integration Solutions for one of the leaders in the global Hospitality Industry. This role is fully remote, and you will be part of an international team. The ideal candidate should be available to work from 9:00 to 18:00 or 10:00 to 19:00 (including a one-hour break). As part of this role, you'll need to coordinate with team members worldwide during certain times. We work with .Net 8.1 and use MySQL and SQL Server as our databases. While knowledge of databases is beneficial, deep expertise is not required since the current work involves minimal interaction with databases, and surface knowledge is sufficient. The Middleware team is responsible for building and maintaining various middleware solutions, including Loyalty/CRM, Exports, Inventory, Ordering, Delivery and Reservations/TMS. Initially, you will focus on one middleware, but you may transition between different projects based on the team’s needs. Our development process includes frameworks for unit testing via Postman API calls. Developers are expected to test their code using these frameworks or extend them when necessary to ensure quality. The role involves both new development and maintenance/support of existing solutions. If you are looking to join a dynamic, global team and contribute to innovative middleware solutions, we’d love to hear from you!
duties: Collaborate with Internal teams and Communicate with External customers
Write, Test and Deploy Applications to Public or Private clouds
Revise, Update, debug and refactor code
Support Internal and External customers
Be available for rotating Escalation in off hours
Follow specifications to build new Integrations
requirements: Minimum 3 - 5 years of professional experience as a C# .NET developer

Ability to work both independently and in teams
Experience with building Web APIs
Experience with utilizing cloud storage in .Net Core applications
Desired: Experience with AWS / Azure clouds, VMs, Docker, AWS ECS
